Articles.Content:
Hello everyone. I made the mistake of playing the demo for about 6 hours. Then I bought the game. 1 week later, lots of YouTube videos and reading the forums, and I have now successfully landed and returned from the Mun! And it only cost me 3 failed first attempts!! I can already tell this game will ruin my free time.

Looking forward to becoming a First Class Rocket Surgeon!

Playing the demo is not a mistake, it helps you learn what the heck you are doing, which is always a good thing.

Anyways, you have bought, welcome to the dark side. We have mainsails.
Welcome to the Space Addicts... May your boosters never fail. And always remember that if they do fail... ADD MOAR BOOSTERS!

Playing the demo is not a mistake, it helps you learn what the heck you are doing, which is always a good thing.

Anyways, you have bought, welcome to the dark side. We have mainsails.

I think that he is referring to getting hooked on the game as a result of playing the demo. A simple design from the demo to get to Mun and back without landing.
When I played the demo, I could never build something that small and make it to the Mun. Now I can make something just a bit bigger go to Minmus.

"When I played the demo, I could never build something that small and make it to the Mun."

It has to use the thrusters for the direct return burn to an aerobraking window to Kerban. That is how tight that design is on fuel.
Welcome aboard! I won the bet! Kerbol is NOT a giant, luminescent bouncey ball! Good luck out there...
